name: lavishly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is expensive or impressive: The dining room was lavishly decorated. They had always lived comfortably, never lavishly.
to a great degree or in large quantities: Her work has been lavishly praised. There's no question that pharmaceutical companies spend lavishly on advertising. See
lavish
More examplesFewer examplesThe palace features 165 lavishly ornate rooms. He made lavishly expensive movies.His family and members of his government live lavishly.The book is a lavishly illustrated account of Britain's country houses.The firm spends lavishly on entertaining.
